required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Real World Evidence of the Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C - An Observational Study in Hungary
clinical_study.official_title: Real World Evidence of the Effectiveness of Paritaprevir/r - Ombitasvir, ± Dasabuvir, ± Ribavirin in Patients With Chronic Hepatitis C - An Observational Study in Hungary - VERITAS

brief_summary.textblock: The study seeks to provide evidence of the effectiveness and obtain patient reported outcome (PRO), work productivity and safety data of the interferon-free regimen of paritaprevir (PTV)/ritonavir (r) + ombitasvir (OBV), ± dasabuvir (DSV), ± ribavirin in chronic hepatitis C virus infected participants.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virological Response 12 Weeks Post-treatment (SVR12)
primary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug (week 24 or 36 depending on the treatment regimen)
primary_outcome.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug. Participants with missing HCV RNA were counted as virological failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Sufficient Follow-up Who Achieved Sustained Virological Response 24 Weeks Post-treatment (SVR24)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after the last dose of study drug (week 36 or 48 depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 24 weeks after the last dose of study drug. The Core population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR24 included all core population participants who had evaluable HCV RNA data ≥ 126 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN or a HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline or had HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline, but no HCV RNA measurement ≥ 126 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN due to reasons related to safety (e.g. dropped out due to adverse event) or virologic failure.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving Virological Response at End of Treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: Virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Relapse
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen) and up to 24 weeks after the end of treatment.
secondary_outcome.description: Relapse was defined as participants with a virologic response (VR; HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL) at end of treatment (EOT) followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL at any time after the end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Breakthrough
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 or 24 weeks (depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: Breakthrough was defined as at least one documented HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL during treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants in Each Non-response Category 12 Weeks Post-treatment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug (week 24 or 36 depending on the treatment regimen)

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adherence to the ABBVIE Regimen, by Adherence Category
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 12 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen.
secondary_outcome.description: Adherence to the ABBVIE treatment regimen is expressed as a percentage of the target dose and was calculated as: Cumulative dose taken / (initial prescribed dose * planned duration) * 100 The ABBVIE regimen consists of paritaprevir/r and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Adherence to Ribavirin by Adherence Category
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 12 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen
secondary_outcome.description: Adherence to ribavirin is expressed as a percentage of the target dose, and was calculated as: Cumulative dose taken / (initial prescribed dose * planned duration) * 100

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Ribavirin Treatment Days in Relation to the Target Number of Ribavirin Treatment Days
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 12 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Received Concomitant Medications
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to end of treatment, 12 to 24 weeks depending on the treatment regimen
secondary_outcome.description: Concomitant medication other than for chronic hepatitis C used from the time when the decision was made to initiate treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir until after the last dose.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events, Serious Adverse Events, or Pregnancies
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From first dose of study drug through 30 days after last dose (16 or 28 weeks depending on the treatment regimen)

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) VAS Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status. The 5 items in the EQ-5D-5L comprise 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) each of which are rated on 5 levels of severity (1: indicating no problem, 2: indicating slight problems, 3: indicating moderate problems, 4: indicating severe problems, 5: indicating extreme problems), and a separate visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS assesses overall health on a scale from 0 (worst health imaginable) to 100 (best health imaginable). The higher the score the better the health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) Index Score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status. The 5 items in the EQ-5D-5L comprise 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) each of which are rated on 5 levels of severity (1: indicating no problem, 2: indicating slight problems, 3: indicating moderate problems, 4: indicating severe problems, 5: indicating extreme problems), and a separate visual analog scale (VAS). Responses to the 5 dimension scores were combined and converted into a single preference-weighted health utility index score by applying country-specific weights.The range for EQ-5D-5L index score is 0 to 1 where '0' is defined as a health state equivalent to being dead and '1' is full health.The higher the score the better the health status.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Absenteeism
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Absenteeism indicates the percentage of work time missed due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Presenteeism
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Presenteeism indicates the percentage of impairment while working due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Work Productivity Impairment (TWP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total work productivity impairment (TWP) indicates the percentage of overall work impairment due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Activity Impairment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
secondary_outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment (TAI) indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Patient Activation Measure 13 (PAM-13)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: PAM-13 is a measure used to assess the patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management, consisting of 13 questions. Each of the 13 items can be answered with one of four possible response options, which are "disagree strongly" (1), "disagree" (2), "agree" (3), "agree strongly" (4). Scores were summed to calculate the overall raw score, then transformed to a scale with a theoretical range 0 to 100, based on calibration tables, with higher PAM scores indicating that the participant is likely to participate more actively in health care processes and takes more responsibility for his or her health.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Who Participated in the AbbVie Patient Support Program (PSP)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to post treatment week 24

secondary_outcome.measure: Utilization of the AbbVie Patient Support Program (PSP) Components
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: At the end of treatment visit participants were asked to indicate which of the following PSP services they had used: Personal support (e.g., Care Coach) Printed educational material Online educational materials Web-portal App

secondary_outcome.measure: Satisfaction With the AbbVie Patient Support Program (PSP) Components
secondary_outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (weeks 12 or 24 depending on treatment regimen)
secondary_outcome.description: At the end of treatment visit participants were asked to indicate their level of satisfaction with each of the PSP services they had used.

arm_group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease. The prescription of treatment regimen was at the discretion of the physician in accordance with local clinical practice and label, was made independently from this observational study and preceded the decision to offer the patient the opportunity to participate in this study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Treatment-naïve or -experienced adult male or female patients with confirmed chronic hepatitis C (CHC), genotype 1 and 4, receiving combination therapy with the interferon-free paritaprevir (PTV)/ritonavir (r) + ombitasvir (OBV), ± dasabuvir (DSV), ± ribavirin (PTV/r+OBV±DSV±RBV) according to standard of care and in line with the current local label.
- If RBV is co-administered with the PTV/r+OBV±DSV±RBV, it has been prescribed in line with the current local label (with special attention to contraception requirements and contraindication during pregnancy).
- Patients must voluntarily sign and date Subject Information Form and Informed Consent Form prior to inclusion into the study.
- Patient must not be participating or intending to participate in a concurrent interventional therapeutic trial.
- Patient has been started on PTV/r+OBV±DSV±RBV therapy no more than one (1) month prior to the study enrollment.
Exclusion Criteria:
• None

participant_flow.recruitment_details: This observational study was conducted in 14 medical centers in Hungary experienced in the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC). The first participant entered the study on November 27, 2015 and last patient last visit was on 23 May 2018.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease. The prescription of treatment regimen was at the discretion of the physician in accordance with local clinical practice and label, was made independently from this observational study and preceded the decision to offer the patient the opportunity to participate in this study.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Age
Age, Customized
Sex: Female, Male
Race/Ethnicity, Customized
Years Since Diagnosis of HCV Infection
Hepatitis C Virus Genotype
Cirrhosis Status
Pretreatment Status
HCV Ribonucleic Acid (RNA) Level
Assigned Treatment
measure.description: Treatment regimen was assigned by the physician according to local practice and label. Participants could receive two (paritaprevir/ritonavir and ombitasvir) or three (paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir) direct-acting antiviral (DAA) drugs with or without ribavirin for 12 or 24 weeks.

measure.title: Co-morbidities

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virological Response 12 Weeks Post-treatment (SVR12)
outcome.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug. Participants with missing HCV RNA were counted as virological failure.
outcome.time_frame: 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug (week 24 or 36 depending on the treatment regimen)
outcome.population: The Core population, defined as enrolled participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype).

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Sustained Virological Response 12 Weeks Post-treatment (SVR12)
measure.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 12 weeks after the last dose of study drug. Participants with missing HCV RNA were counted as virological failure.
measure.population: The Core population, defined as enrolled participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Sufficient Follow-up Who Achieved Sustained Virological Response 24 Weeks Post-treatment (SVR24)
outcome.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 24 weeks after the last dose of study drug. The Core population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR24 included all core population participants who had evaluable HCV RNA data ≥ 126 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN or a HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline or had HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline, but no HCV RNA measurement ≥ 126 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN due to reasons related to safety (e.g. dropped out due to adverse event) or virologic failure.
outcome.time_frame: 24 weeks after the last dose of study drug (week 36 or 48 depending on the treatment regimen)
outcome.population: The Core population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR24

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Sufficient Follow-up Who Achieved Sustained Virological Response 24 Weeks Post-treatment (SVR24)
measure.description: Sustained virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL 24 weeks after the last dose of study drug. The Core population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR24 included all core population participants who had evaluable HCV RNA data ≥ 126 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN or a HCV RNA value ≥ 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline or had HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL at the last measurement post-baseline, but no HCV RNA measurement ≥ 126 days after the last actual dose of the ABBVIE REGIMEN due to reasons related to safety (e.g. dropped out due to adverse event) or virologic failure.
measure.population: The Core population with sufficient follow-up data regarding SVR24

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Virological Response at End of Treatment
outcome.description: Virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL.
outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
outcome.population: The Core population defined as enrolled participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype).

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving Virological Response at End of Treatment
measure.description: Virologic response was defined as hepatitis C virus ribonucleic acid (HCV RNA) levels less than 50 IU/mL.
measure.population: The Core population defined as enrolled participants who were adequately treated according to the standard of care and within local label recommendations for their specific disease characteristics (cirrhotic status, genotype).

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Relapse
outcome.description: Relapse was defined as participants with a virologic response (VR; HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL) at end of treatment (EOT) followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL at any time after the end of treatment.
outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen) and up to 24 weeks after the end of treatment.
outcome.population: The Core population with VR at EOT, who completed treatment, and had ≥ 1 HCV RNA measurement ≥ 70 days post-treatment or were a treatment failure between EOT and day 70.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Relapse
measure.description: Relapse was defined as participants with a virologic response (VR; HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL) at end of treatment (EOT) followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL at any time after the end of treatment.
measure.population: The Core population with VR at EOT, who completed treatment, and had ≥ 1 HCV RNA measurement ≥ 70 days post-treatment or were a treatment failure between EOT and day 70.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Breakthrough
outcome.description: Breakthrough was defined as at least one documented HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL followed by HCV RNA ≥ 50 IU/mL during treatment.
outcome.time_frame: 12 or 24 weeks (depending on the treatment regimen)
outcome.population: The Core population with at least one documented HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL while on treatment and at least one on-treatment or EOT measurement thereafter.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Breakthrough

measure.population: The Core population with at least one documented HCV RNA < 50 IU/mL while on treatment and at least one on-treatment or EOT measurement thereafter.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events, Serious Adverse Events, or Pregnancies
measure.population: All treated participants

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) VAS Score
outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status. The 5 items in the EQ-5D-5L comprise 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) each of which are rated on 5 levels of severity (1: indicating no problem, 2: indicating slight problems, 3: indicating moderate problems, 4: indicating severe problems, 5: indicating extreme problems), and a separate visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS assesses overall health on a scale from 0 (worst health imaginable) to 100 (best health imaginable). The higher the score the better the health status.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir + Dasabuvir Without RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir without ribavirin for 12 or 24 weeks.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir + Dasabuvir With RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir with ribavirin for 12 or 24 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) VAS Score
measure.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status. The 5 items in the EQ-5D-5L comprise 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) each of which are rated on 5 levels of severity (1: indicating no problem, 2: indicating slight problems, 3: indicating moderate problems, 4: indicating severe problems, 5: indicating extreme problems), and a separate visual analog scale (VAS). The VAS assesses overall health on a scale from 0 (worst health imaginable) to 100 (best health imaginable). The higher the score the better the health status.
measure.population: Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) Index Score
outcome.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status. The 5 items in the EQ-5D-5L comprise 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) each of which are rated on 5 levels of severity (1: indicating no problem, 2: indicating slight problems, 3: indicating moderate problems, 4: indicating severe problems, 5: indicating extreme problems), and a separate visual analog scale (VAS). Responses to the 5 dimension scores were combined and converted into a single preference-weighted health utility index score by applying country-specific weights.The range for EQ-5D-5L index score is 0 to 1 where '0' is defined as a health state equivalent to being dead and '1' is full health.The higher the score the better the health status.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir + Dasabuvir Without RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir without ribavirin for 12 or 24 weeks.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir + Dasabuvir With RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir with ribavirin for 12 or 24 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in EuroQol 5 Dimension 5 Level (EQ-5D-5L) Index Score
measure.description: The EQ-5D-5L is a health state utility instrument that evaluates preference for health status. The 5 items in the EQ-5D-5L comprise 5 dimensions (mobility, self-care, usual activities, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression) each of which are rated on 5 levels of severity (1: indicating no problem, 2: indicating slight problems, 3: indicating moderate problems, 4: indicating severe problems, 5: indicating extreme problems), and a separate visual analog scale (VAS). Responses to the 5 dimension scores were combined and converted into a single preference-weighted health utility index score by applying country-specific weights.The range for EQ-5D-5L index score is 0 to 1 where '0' is defined as a health state equivalent to being dead and '1' is full health.The higher the score the better the health status.
measure.population: Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Absenteeism
outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Absenteeism indicates the percentage of work time missed due to health problems.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: The Core population who were employed and with available data at baseline and each time point.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Absenteeism
measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Absenteeism indicates the percentage of work time missed due to health problems.
measure.population: The Core population who were employed and with available data at baseline and each time point.

outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Presenteeism indicates the percentage of impairment while working due to health problems.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: The Core population who were employed and with available data at baseline and each time point.

measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Presenteeism indicates the percentage of impairment while working due to health problems.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Work Productivity Impairment (TWP)
outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total work productivity impairment (TWP) indicates the percentage of overall work impairment due to health problems.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: The Core population who were employed and with available data at baseline and each time point.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Work Productivity Impairment (TWP)
measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total work productivity impairment (TWP) indicates the percentage of overall work impairment due to health problems.
measure.population: The Core population who were employed and with available data at baseline and each time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Activity Impairment
outcome.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment (TAI) indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline, end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen), and at 12 and 24 weeks after end of treatment
outcome.population: The Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Work Productivity and Activity Impairment (WPAI): Total Activity Impairment
measure.description: The WPAI Hepatitis C V2.0 is an HCV specific questionnaire used to measure work absenteeism, work presenteeism, and daily activity impairment. Respondents were asked about time missed from work and time while at work during which productivity was impaired in the past seven days. Results of WPAI are expressed as a percentage of impairment from 0 to 100, with higher percentages indicating greater impairment and less productivity. Total activity impairment (TAI) indicates the percentage of general (non-work) activity impairment due to health problems.
measure.population: The Core population with available data at baseline and each time point.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Patient Activation Measure 13 (PAM-13)
outcome.description: PAM-13 is a measure used to assess the patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management, consisting of 13 questions. Each of the 13 items can be answered with one of four possible response options, which are "disagree strongly" (1), "disagree" (2), "agree" (3), "agree strongly" (4). Scores were summed to calculate the overall raw score, then transformed to a scale with a theoretical range 0 to 100, based on calibration tables, with higher PAM scores indicating that the participant is likely to participate more actively in health care processes and takes more responsibility for his or her health.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline and end of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
outcome.population: The Core population with available data at baseline and end of treatment.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir + Dasabuvir Without RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir without ribavirin for 12 or 24 weeks.

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir + Dasabuvir With RBV
group.description: Participants received paritaprevir/ritonavir, ombitasvir, and dasabuvir with ribavirin for 12 or 24 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Baseline in Patient Activation Measure 13 (PAM-13)
measure.description: PAM-13 is a measure used to assess the patient knowledge, skill, and confidence for self-management, consisting of 13 questions. Each of the 13 items can be answered with one of four possible response options, which are "disagree strongly" (1), "disagree" (2), "agree" (3), "agree strongly" (4). Scores were summed to calculate the overall raw score, then transformed to a scale with a theoretical range 0 to 100, based on calibration tables, with higher PAM scores indicating that the participant is likely to participate more actively in health care processes and takes more responsibility for his or her health.
measure.population: The Core population with available data at baseline and end of treatment.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Who Participated in the AbbVie Patient Support Program (PSP)
outcome.time_frame: Up to post treatment week 24
outcome.population: Core population

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Number of Participants Who Participated in the AbbVie Patient Support Program (PSP)
measure.population: Core population

outcome.title: Utilization of the AbbVie Patient Support Program (PSP) Components
outcome.description: At the end of treatment visit participants were asked to indicate which of the following PSP services they had used: Personal support (e.g., Care Coach) Printed educational material Online educational materials Web-portal App
outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (week 12 or 24 depending on the treatment regimen)
outcome.population: Core population who participated in the PSP

group.title: Paritaprevir/Ritonavir + Ombitasvir ± Dasabuvir ± Ribavirin
group.description: Participants in this observational study received treatment with paritaprevir/ritonavir (r) and ombitasvir with or without dasabuvir ± ribavirin (RBV) for 12 or 24 weeks for the treatment of chronic hepatitis C (CHC), according to hepatitis C virus (HCV) genotype/subtype and stage of liver disease.

measure.title: Utilization of the AbbVie Patient Support Program (PSP) Components
measure.description: At the end of treatment visit participants were asked to indicate which of the following PSP services they had used: Personal support (e.g., Care Coach) Printed educational material Online educational materials Web-portal App
measure.population: Core population who participated in the PSP

outcome.title: Satisfaction With the AbbVie Patient Support Program (PSP) Components
outcome.description: At the end of treatment visit participants were asked to indicate their level of satisfaction with each of the PSP services they had used.
outcome.time_frame: End of treatment (weeks 12 or 24 depending on treatment regimen)
outcome.population: Core population who participated in the PSP with available data

reported_events.time_frame: From first dose of study drug to 30 days after last dose (16 to 28 weeks depending on treatment regimen)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: AbbVie requests that any investigator or institution that plans on presenting/publishing results disclosure, provide written notification of their request 60 days prior to their presentation/publication. AbbVie requests that no presentation/publication will be instituted until 12 months after a study is completed, or after the first presentation/publication whichever occurs first. A delay may be proposed of a presentation/publication if AbbVie needs to secure patent or proprietary protection.
